content:
Good day,
as simp is unpredictable, I'm looking for something to use to do "mass elimination", applying all the equalities that are in my local context. Would be useful after injection, because injection naming feature is kind of bad - it counts implicit variables even if generated equalities are just x = x, and silently discards ones too sometimes (not sure how it works).
Is there a tactic that would just try all of the equality hypotheses as rewrites?
You can do something like simp_all only to rewrite with everything everywhere without using simp lemmas.I don't see how simp's behavior is unpredictable.
